climbs.name: We Never Get the Girls
climbs.fa: (TR) Steve Powers  2004, FL: Steven Powers, Frasier Haney, Tim Pinar  5/04

content.description:
This route uses the first bolt from "Amanda" but then fades right, achieves a ledge, past two more bolts of vertical face climbing, through the notch to a few more bolts on a devious slab.

Not too terribly difficult but the route cultivates a taste for the awkward on the obvious-looking, bigger moves.

But after clipping the last bolt, it's some awkward feet balancing and nuance on slab. Found it frightening (but that last bolt, from your knees, cheers you on smilingly.)

Do the route while you climb Amanda and Elixer, it will make you think.
content.protection:
Two bolt anchor at the top (the left hanger was a tad loose as of my ascent).

Not too much gear is needed - a small rack of cams and handful of draws.

climbs.name: Hot Tubs From Hell
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon and Todd Swain, Nov. 1989

content.description: A fun route, with jams and steep face moves in a dihedral
content.location: This climb is just to the left of a chimney.

climbs.name: Hot Tub of Death
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon and Todd Swain, Nov. 1989

content.description: A fun, varied, steep crack climb with a small roof.  This route faces southwest, so it gets sun after late morning.
content.location: This is a right-slanting crack near the center of the formation.

climbs.name: From Here To Infirmary
climbs.fa: Todd Swain and Todd Gordon, Nov. 1989

content.description: Short but worth doing, with a crux hand/wide hands roof crack
content.location: On the wall well to the left of the chimney

climbs.name: Elixir
climbs.fa: (TR) Todd Swain, FL: Bob Gaines & Yvonne Gaines, February 1996

content.description:
This is the bolted face just left of

The Dharma Bums

(5.8). Three bolts and some additional pro see you to the anchors.
Distinct hand and fist crack on the narrow SW face, up past several horizontals.  Bolted face line of Elixir to its left and Amanda to its right

This is the bolted face route just right of

The Dharma Bums

(5.8), and climbs past several horizontals and 5 bolts to a bolted anchor atop the formation. Two stars out of five.
